data: MANDATORY REQUIREMENT PRIOR TO INITIATING PROCEDURE - Chest X-ray confirming placement of pleural drain within last 48 hours, unless inserted intraoperatively
For Intrapleural Instillation By Provider or Nurse Practitioner Only
-20 cm H2O suction, after clamp  removed
If patient develops any of the following post Intrapleural Fibrinolytics:
Follow the same sequence of administration for any repeat doses
Clinical event: Pre-procedure of Intrapleural fibrinolytics
Coordinate with Pharmacy for dosing times
10 mg, intrapleural, once, administer over: 5 minute, drug form: inj
10 mg, intrapleural, qdaily, administer over: 5 minute, order duration: 3 day, drug form: inj
10 mg, intrapleural, BID, administer over: 5 minute, order duration: 3 day, drug form: inj,
10 mg, intrapleural,q12h interval, administer over: 5 minute, order duration: 3 day, drug form: inj,
5 mg, intrapleural, once, administer over: 5 minute, drug form: inj
5 mg, intrapleural, qdaily, administer over: 5 minute, order duration: 3 day, drug form: inj
5 mg, intrapleural, BID, administer over: 5 minute, order duration: 3 day, drug form: inj,
5 mg, intrapleural, q12h interval, administer over: 5 minute, order duration: 3 day, drug form: inj,
Ensure CBC, PTT and INR done within 24 hours prior to procedure then daily CBC
Blood, AM draw, Collection T+1;0330, once
Blood, AM draw, Collection T+1;0330, qdaily for 3 day
Blood, AM draw, Collection T+1;0330, once
Blood, AM draw, Collection T+1;0330, qdaily for 3 day
Blood, AM draw, Collection T+1;0330, once
Blood, AM draw, Collection T+1;0330, qdaily for 3 day
T+1; Timed, Reason: During intrapleural fibrinolytics administration, 1 day after fibrinolytic treatment
T+2; N+5, Timed, Reason: During intrapleural fibrinolytics administration, 2 day after fibrinolytic treatment
Consider Consult to Respiratory, Trauma or Critical Care
